newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: CRICKET-TUFNELL, CROFT FIGHT BACK AFTER HOUGHTON CENTURY.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-TUFNELL, CROFT FIGHT BACK AFTER HOUGHTON CENTURY.

text.p: Left-arm spinner Phil Tufnell and off-spinner Robert Croft snapped up six Mashonaland wickets in the last nine overs of the day to ease England's plight after they were punished by a sparkling century from David Houghton on Wednesday.
Tufnell and Croft sent the local side tumbling from 258 for three to 279 for nine at the close of the second day of the four-day match in reply to England's first innings of 197.
Mashonaland lead by 82 with one wicket left after Tufnell, who has taken four for 77, and Croft, with four for 65, brought the touring side back into contention.

Until the collapse, England's attack had been dominated by Zimbabwe coach Houghton, who struck 110. He was rarely troubled in a three-hour stay and brought up his century in majestic fashion by sweeping Tufnell over the square leg boundary for six.
He was finally removed by the same bowler, who took a return catch as the batsman pushed forward tiredly, to end a fourth-wicket partnership of 116 with Craig Wishart (45).
Houghton reached three figures from 136 balls, and made his 110 off 141 deliveries, hitting 14 fours and two sixes.
His departure started the Marshonaland collapse.
Croft removed the next four batsmen in 17 balls at a cost of only one run -- three of them to close catches -- and Tufnell continued to transform England's fortunes by having Bryan Strang lbw.
Zimbabwe captain Alistair Campbell earlier scored 55 before he was caught at slip off Tufnell, one of several decisions with which the batsmen or fielding side clearly disagreed.

Andy Caddick was again expensive (10-2-46-0) but Darren Gough bowled a fiery spell -- striking opener Stuart Carlisle on the helmet with one bouncer -- and Alan Mullally again bowled a probing line without success.
Croft's four-wicket haul added to his success with the bat. He finished with an unbeaten 80, easily England's highest score, as they extended the overnight 175 for nine to 197.
